title: Is this Djokovic's last chance to win a final Grand Slam?
description: Wimbledon is likely Djokovic's greatest opportunity to win a record 25th Grand Slam. Can he possibly do it?
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Swiatek fights back, reaches Wimbledon 3rd round
description: Iga Swiatek may not love the grass, but she relishes a battle whatever the surface and showed all that fight and bullish determination as she recovered to beat American Caty McNally 5-7, 6-2, 6-1 and reach the Wimbledon third round on Thursday.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Wimbledon tennis schedule?
description: Carlos Alcaraz, the two-time defending Wimbledon champion, is back in action Friday at SW19, headlining the day's order of play. Other players who will compete on the fifth day of the main draw include fifth seed Taylor Fritz and home favourite Cameron Norrie. View Friday's featured matches below and the full order of play here. Centre Court (starts 1:30 p.m.)  [5] Taylor Fritz (USA) vs. [26] Alejandro Davidovich Fokina (ESP) Not before 3 p.m. [2] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) vs. Jan-Lennard Struff (GER) [1] Aryna Sabalenka vs. Emma Raducanu (GBR) No. 1 Court (starts 1 p.m.) Diane Parry (FRA) vs. Sonay Kartal (GBR) Mattia Bellucci (ITA) vs. Cameron Norrie (GBR) [14] Elina Svitolina (UKR) vs. [24] Elise Mertens (BEL) Read More from Wimbledon: Draper: Most players don't bully me, Cilic did Shelton unable to convert 3 MPs before play suspended Munar converts 11th MP in rollercoaster [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What were the Wimbledon results?
description: Top seed Jannik Sinner and seven-time champion Novak Djokovic cruised through their second-round matches Thursday at Wimbledon, while fourth seed Jack Draper fell against 2014 US Open champion Marin Cilic.  View Thursday's featured results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores. Centre Court [6] Novak Djokovic (SRB) def. Daniel Evans (GBR) 6-3, 6-2, 6-0 [8] Iga Swiatek (POL) def. Caty McNally (USA) 5-7, 6-2, 6-1 [1] Jannik Sinner (ITA) def. Aleksandar Vukic (AUS) 6-1, 6-1, 6-3 No. 1 Court [7] Mirra Andreeva def. Lucia Bronzetti (ITA) 6-1, 7-6(4) [11] Elena Rybakina [KAZ] def. Maria Sakkari (GRE) 6-3, 6-1 Marin Cilic [CRO] def. [4] Jack Draper (GBR) 6-4, 6-3, 1-6, 6-4 Read More from Wimbledon: Draper: Most players don't bully me, Cilic did Shelton unable to convert 3 MPs before play suspended Munar converts 11th MP in rollercoaster [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: 'Still holes in my game' - Draper on Wimbledon exit
description: Jack Draper says he was not "good enough" in his shock Wimbledon exit, insisting it was not because he felt increased pressure at this year's tournament.

title: Why have record number of seeded players lost at Wimbledon?
description: With a record number of huge shocks in the opening days at Wimbledon, BBC Sport takes a look at some of the reasons why.

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Four Recap
description: Day Four at Wimbledon produced two dominant displays from the top seeds, a few throwback performances, and one dramatic five-set battle. Novak Djokovic made light work of Dan Evans in a clinical Centre Court showing, while Jannik Sinner coasted past Aleksandar Vukic in straight sets. Elsewhere, Sebastian Ofner upset 13th seed Tommy Paul, and Marin …
author: Jonathan

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Three Recap
description: Day three of Wimbledon 2025 delivered a mix of dominant performances, lengthy battles, and a couple more surprising upsets under cloudy London skies. Carlos Alcaraz returned to top form, while Cameron Norrie and João Fonseca recorded impressive wins. With this side of the draw already thin on the ground for top seeds after Monday’s opening …
author: Jonathan
